newsitem.title: USA: GPU replaces electrical cables at NJ nuke.
newsitem.headline: GPU replaces electrical cables at NJ nuke.

text.p: GPU Nuclear said Tuesday it was replacing some electrical cables at its 610 megawatt (MW) Oyster Creek nuclear power plant after idling the unit Friday because of fluctuating levels of generator cooling water.
"We found that we needed replacement of electrical cables," said a company spokeswoman, adding the cooling water problem had been corrected.
The cables run to an electrical system that operates one of the plant's emergency diesel generators.
"That'll take a few days," she replied when asked how long it would take to complete the task.
She said the utility still did not set a startup schedule for Oyster Creek.
GPU Nuclear operates the Forked River, N.J., facility, and its parent GPU Inc owns the plant.
